instruction: Use the PCA method to create a linear combination of factors that capture the majority of the diversity in behavior of those factors during the period from Feb. 24 through April 20 driven by COVID-19.
output: Okay, I will use the PCA method to identify the principal components that best capture the variability in factor performance during the period from Feb. 24 through April 20 driven by COVID-19. This will allow me to create a linear combination of factors that capture the majority of the diversity in behavior of those factors. However, I need to keep in mind that if there are factors that are highly correlated or anti-correlated to one another, it may load on one but not others if the “others” do not provide additional information. Additionally, the first principal component captured approximately 20% of the variability in factor performance among styles and industries in GEMTR, and the correlations in weights between the PCA method and methods 1 and 2 were 0.80 and 0.77, respectively. Finally, at the stock level, the cross-sectional correlation of exposures between this method and methods 1 and 2 are 0.83 and 0.89, respectively.
